intro: Hieracium culmenicola, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with serrated edges. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing yellow daisy-like blooms. The leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a distinct reddish or purple hue on the underside.
